Article Title: Connor McDavid Trade Bombshell to the Bruins: NHL insiders say it could guarantee a Stanley Cup win
Article Text:
Insiders call Connor McDavid a “Stanley Cup cheat code” (Imagn Images)

Bruins insiders make bold Stanley Cup prediction if Connor McDavid lands in Boston

Should Bruins TRADE Pavel Zacha? | Bruins Beat

Connor McDavid’s uncertain future has the entire NHL holding its breath

As NHL free agency and trade talks ramp up, one name continues to dominate every rumor mill—Connor McDavid. With his contract situation still unresolved in Edmonton, speculation is heating up across the league. Among the teams linked to the Oilers captain, the Boston Bruins have now entered the conversation—and some local media believe a potential McDavid deal could change everything.During the August 1 episode of Bruins Beat, reporters Evan Marinofsky and Conor Ryan briefly entertained the fantasy of Connor McDavid wearing a black and gold jersey. Marinofsky tossed out the question, “What if McDavid ended up with the Bruins?” Ryan’s response was immediate and emphatic: “I mean, they’d win a cup. They would, yeah.”That may sound like a stretch—but Ryan doubled down. Calling McDavid “the easiest cheat code,” he drew a parallel to another generational athlete: “I think McDavid is so dominant now that he’s kind of like LeBron during his prime, right? Where, like just him alone, you’re going to be in the third round if not in the final.”Ryan also acknowledged the financial weight that a McDavid contract would carry—likely in the ballpark of $15.5 to $16 million per year, a new NHL record.Yet he argued that even at that cost, McDavid would be worth every penny.After another playoff letdown for the Oilers in June, Connor McDavid’s long-term commitment to Edmonton has come under question. The 2024 Conn Smythe winner has recorded at least 90 points in all nine of his NHL seasons—yet remains without a Stanley Cup. His contract talks have reportedly stalled, and the league is taking notice.Connor McDavid made his priorities clear in a recent interview: “Winning is the most important thing… If I feel there’s a good window to win here over and over again, then signing is no problem.” That statement leaves the door open for other franchises—like the Bruins—to make their pitch. Whether Boston is a serious contender or just a fan-fueled fantasy, one thing is certain: until McDavid re-signs, the NHL rumor machine won’t slow down.Also Read: Connor McDavid to the Maple Leafs? Rumors swirl as NHL insider insists it’s Toronto or nowhere The Oilers are expected to have $45 million in open contract space next offseason, so there won't be much excuse for not giving McDavid something between $16-20 million per year.Connor McDavid is one of only two players – after fellow Oilers captain Wayne Gretzky in 1982 – to unanimously win the Hart Memorial Trophy as the league's most valuable player.
Article Summary: Insiders call connor mcdavid a “stanley cup cheat code” (imagn images) conor ryan: “i mean, they’d win a cup. They would, yeah” evan marinofsky and conor ryan briefly entertained the fantasy of mcdavid wearing a black and gold jersey.

Article Title: India upcoming matches 2025: When will India play next after England Tests?
Article Text:
Shubman Gill leads Team India (PTI Photo)

India vs England Day 5: Can India do the UNTHINKABLE at The Oval? Four wickets and 2-2!

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Asia Cup 2025

Poll Which upcoming India series are you more excited for? Asia Cup 2025 Australia Tour (ODIs & T20Is)

Test Series vs West Indies

Limited-Overs Tour of Australia

South Africa Tour of India

India’s Upcoming Fixtures

Asia Cup 2025

Sep 10 – vs UAE (Dubai)

Sep 14 – vs Pakistan (Dubai)

Sep 19 – vs Oman (Abu Dhabi)

Test Series vs West Indies

Oct 02 – 1st Test (Ahmedabad)

Oct 10 – 2nd Test (Delhi)

Australia Tour (ODIs + T20Is)

Oct 19 – 1st ODI (Perth)

Oct 23 – 2nd ODI (Adelaide)

Oct 25 – 3rd ODI (Sydney)

Oct 29 – 1st T20I (Canberra)

Oct 31 – 2nd T20I (Melbourne)

Nov 02 – 3rd T20I (Hobart)

Nov 06 – 4th T20I (Gold Coast)

Nov 08 – 5th T20I (Brisbane)

South Africa Tour of India

Nov 14 – 1st Test (Kolkata)

Nov 22 – 2nd Test (Guwahati)

Nov 30 – 1st ODI (Ranchi)

Dec 03 – 2nd ODI (Raipur)

Dec 06 – 3rd ODI (Visakhapatnam)

Dec 09 – 1st T20I (Cuttack)

Dec 11 – 2nd T20I (Mullanpur)

Dec 14 – 3rd T20I (Dharamsala)

Dec 17 – 4th T20I (Lucknow)

Dec 19 – 5th T20I (Ahmedabad)

NEW DELHI: After their gripping 2-2 Test series draw against England, India’s cricket calendar remains packed for the remainder of 2025, with tournaments and bilateral series across formats.Mohammed Siraj was the standout performer at The Oval, where his 5-wicket haul sealed a thrilling six-run victory to draw the series.Now, attention shifts to the months ahead as India prepare for a busy international season.India's next assignment will be the Asia Cup, beginning in September. With senior players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli having retired from T20Is post the 2024 World Cup, Suryakumar Yadav will lead a relatively young squad. The BCCI is expected to rest several Test regulars from the England series to manage workload.India will face UAE, Pakistan, and Oman in the group stage, with all matches to be held in the UAE.In October, India will return to the red-ball format, hosting West Indies for a two-match Test series. The matches will take place in Ahmedabad and Delhi, marking the beginning of India’s next WTC cycle campaign.Following the West Indies Tests, India will fly to Australia for three ODIs and five T20Is.This series will mark the return of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli to the national side, as they continue in the 50-over format. The tour starts with an ODI in Perth on October 19.India will end their year with a full home series against South Africa in November–December. The Proteas will play two Tests, three ODIs, and five T20Is, making it one of the lengthiest bilateral tours of the year.*only group-stage matches
Article Summary: India's next assignment will be the asia cup, beginning in september. In october, india will return to the red-ball format, hosting west indies for a two-match test series. India will end their year with a full home series against south africa in november–december.

Article Title: Dennis Rodman's daughter Trinity gets heartfelt praise from Los Angeles Lakers legend Magic Johnson after her latest achievement
Article Text:
Magic Johnson and Trinity. Image via: Juan Ocampo/NBAE via Getty Images | Brad Smith/ISI Photos / Getty Images

Trinity Rodman earns heartfelt praise from Lakers legend Magic Johnson

Trinity explained her relationship with her father, Dennis Rodman

Trinity Rodman made headlines once again as the Washington Spirit forward delivered a stunning game-winning goal against the Portland Thorns, marking her return from injury in spectacular style. The moment was enough to electrify the crowd. He stunning performance also earned a public message of praise from Los Angeles Lakers legend and part-owner of the Spirit, Magic Johnson.On a thrilling evening in D.C., Rodman reminded fans why she’s a generational talent. With just minutes left on the clock, she buried a decisive goal to give the Washington Spirit a 2–1 victory. For Trinity, it was a storybook return after injury kept her sidelined for weeks.Magic Johnson, who is part of the Spirit’s ownership group, didn’t hold back his excitement on X.He wrote, “Welcome back superstar Trinity Rodman! Congratulations on scoring the game winning goal for our Washington Spirit in a 2-1 victory over the Portland Thorns. The entire National Women’s Soccer League (NWSL) has missed you!”It wasn’t the first time Johnson praised the young forward, but this moment carried added emotion.After all, Rodman’s prowess in the game has become as much a part of her identity as her footwork and finishing.In an emotionally raw interview earlier this year on Call Her Daddy, she opened up about her strained relationship with her father, NBA Hall of Famer Dennis Rodman. "My dad, he likes to be in control. So he would take us shopping, get us phones, do this, do that. 'Oh, I'm going to take you and your brother shopping,' and me and my brother are like, 'We don't want to go shopping, we just want money to go get In-N-Out after school with our friends," Trinity said."So it was like, he wouldn't give us money to do that. He needed to have the control of bringing us shopping and swiping his own card. But if we asked, 'Hey, could we have $100 to go get food, to go to Claire's to get my ears pierced,' just little stuff like that? He was like, 'No. You're using me.'"“He’s not a dad,” Trinity continued. “Maybe by blood, but nothing else. Hearing his voice is painful.”She described a childhood marked by instability, often living in a car with her mother, while her father’s absence left emotional gaps. Even when Dennis Rodman showed up — like when he surprised her at her NWSL debut — the gestures felt more about control or spectacle than support.“I answer the phone now for my conscience,” she added, “to be like, he needed to hear my voice before anything else happens.”Also Read: Indiana Pacers star Tyrese Haliburton attends WWE SummerSlam in style amid his Achilles injury Despite the emotional weight she carries, Trinity Rodman continues to shine on her own terms. She’s earned a World Cup appearance, Olympic gold, and now, the admiration of sporting legends like Magic Johnson. And as for Johnson, he is known for his extensive support for athletes of basketball or any other sports.
Article Summary: Trinity rodman scored the game-winning goal for the washington spirit against the portland thorns. Los angeles lakers legend and part-owner of the spirit, magic johnson, congratulated her on twitter. Rodman recently opened up about her strained relationship with her father, dennis rodman.

Article Title: “I feel guilty”: Christian McCaffrey can’t stop admiring Olivia Culpo’s strength in emotional message after baby’s arrival
Article Text:
Christian McCaffrey opens up on Olivia Culpo’s postpartum journey (Getty Images)

Christian McCaffrey hails wife Olivia Culpo as ‘real MVP’ in touching tribute after birth of their daughter



Olivia Culpo’s tough pregnancy journey reveals deeper layers of love



Amidst the rigors of NFL training camp, Christian McCaffrey is finding inspiration far beyond the gridiron. The San Francisco 49ers running back recently opened up about life as a new dad and offered a touching tribute to his wife, Olivia Culpo , following the arrival of their daughter, Colette Annalise McCaffrey, born on July 13. While McCaffrey may be battling defensive lines, at home, he says it’s Culpo who’s doing the heavy lifting.As Christian McCaffrey returns to training camp, he gave fans a glimpse into his journey through early fatherhood and his admiration for Culpo’s resilience. “She’s been great. She’s been so cool… I feel guilty at times,” McCaffrey admitted. “I’m sleeping well in the hotel bedroom while she’s doing the dirty work, but super thankful for it—and she’s doing an incredible job.”While he trains with the 49ers, Culpo remains home caring for their newborn, supported by both families who’ve stepped in to help the first-time parents. Their joint announcement on social media revealed the birth of Colette, accompanied by intimate photos—one especially moving image captured McCaffrey holding Culpo’s hand during her C-section, a moment that echoed their unwavering bond.Culpo, 33, hasn’t held back her appreciation either.In a heartwarming Instagram story, she called McCaffrey the “best daddy in the world,” adding, “We’re going to miss him so much,” along with a crying emoji, as he headed off to camp.Though the couple now celebrates their growing family, the road wasn’t easy. Culpo had been candid about her physically taxing pregnancy. Back in March, she shared on TikTok that she had battled pneumonia and remained on bed rest for nearly a month. Her condition worsened when she was diagnosed with a subchorionic hematoma—a bleeding complication that can pose risks during early pregnancy.“So at this point, I was so exhausted… two weeks of just not being able to move and then all of a sudden just purging,” she said. “It was a lot. It was heavy… I went to the doctor and it was really exciting to see that there was still a heartbeat.”Through all the exhaustion, fear, and joy, McCaffrey and Culpo have emerged as a team—weathering challenges with grace. While McCaffrey may be chasing another Super Bowl, it’s clear who he believes is the real MVP at home.Also Read: Are wedding bells next? Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce’s Cleveland house hunt ignites marriage speculation
Article Summary: Christian mccaffrey opened up about life as a new dad and offered a touching tribute to his wife, olivia culpo. The san francisco 49ers running back gave fans a glimpse into his journey through early fatherhood. While he trains with the 49ers, culpo remains home caring for their newborn.

Article Title: NBA Trade Rumors: Golden State Warriors Could Target $33.3 Million Washington Wizards Star to Support Stephen Curry and jIMMY Butler
Article Text:
Jimmy Butler and Stephen Curry (Image credit: Getty Images)

Golden State Warriors

Points Rebounds Assists FG% 3P% 23.6

Is It Worth the Risk?

Theare no strangers to making bold veteran signings in pursuit of another championship. With Stephen Curry still performing at an elite level, every roster move matters - and while much of the talk this offseason has revolved around Boston’s Al Horford, there’s another name that could quietly fit the bill. Former Milwaukee Bucks star and NBA champion Khris Middleton, though past his peak, might be exactly the kind of experienced, playoff-tested player the Warriors need to stabilize their wing depth and boost their scoring options.Blue Man Hoop's G. C. Bellchamber pointed out Khris Middleton’s unexpected departure from Milwaukee, saying, “After parts of 11 seasons with the Milwaukee Bucks , Middleton was shockingly dealt to the (Washington) Wizards in the middle of last season as a result of the Bucks’ tenuous cap situation.” (H/t: Sporting News)While his exit was abrupt, Middleton showed he could still contribute in Washington.Now entering the final year of a three-year, $93 million extension signed with Milwaukee, Middleton could soon be a buyout candidate. Washington’s decision to focus on its younger core - parting ways with other veterans like Marcus Smart - only strengthens that possibility.If available, Middleton could be a valuable addition to the Golden State Warriors ’ rotation. His experience and composure would help stabilize the team’s wing depth, particularly around young forward Moses Moody.• Veteran leadership for a team still aiming for a title run• Proven playoff performer with championship experience• Capable of being a reliable third or fourth scoring option• Defensive versatility at 6-foot-7• Ability to play alongside elite talent without disrupting chemistryMiddleton thrived as Giannis Antetokounmpo’s right-hand man during the Bucks’ championship run. His playoff numbers in 2021 reflect his impact:His steady scoring and clutch performances were vital in helping Milwaukee secure the title.At 33, Middleton’s athleticism and production have dipped, but his skill set and experience remain valuable. For the Golden State Warriors, who are still in win-now mode with Curry leading the charge, the move could be a low-cost way to strengthen their roster for a playoff push.Also read: Boston Celtics Weigh Trade Options and Roster Adjustments Ahead of 2025-26 Season The decision will ultimately come down to whether Golden State sees Middleton as a short-term spark or chooses to keep its current core intact.
Article Summary: Khris middleton could be a buyout candidate for the golden state warriors. The 33-year-old was traded to the washington wizards in the middle of last season. Middleton thrived as giannis antetokounmpo’s right-hand man during the bucks’ championship run. His playoff numbers in 2021 reflect his impact.

Article Title: Why the Los Angeles Lakers Could Part Ways With $55 Million Father-Son Duo for San Antonio Spurs Young Talent and Pick Swaps
Article Text:
Lebron James and Bronny James (Image via Getty)

Los Angeles Lakers

LeBron James

Proposed Los Angeles Lakers-Spurs Trade

Trade Proposal

LeBron James at the Playoffs against the Timberwolves (Image via Imagn).

Los Angeles Lakers Receive San Antonio Spurs Receive Devin Vassell



LeBron James



Keldon Johnson



Bronny James



2031 first-round pick swap (via Kings)



2032 first-round pick swap





Why This Deal Could Work for the Los Angeles Lakers

San Antonio Spurs’ Perspective

Theappear to be fully invested in building around Luka Doncic , signaling a significant shift in the franchise’s priorities. According to recent reports, the team is no longer tailoring its plans around. While relations between LeBron and the Lakers are calm for now, the possibility of a trade request remains in the background.LeBron’s large contract and no-trade clause make moving him a complicated process, but that hasn’t stopped trade scenarios from circulating. One of the more intriguing proposals comes from Bleacher Report’s Andy Bailey, who has outlined a deal that would send both LeBron and his son, Bronny James, to a Western Conference rival.Bailey’s hypothetical trade involves the San Antonio Spurs acquiring the father-son duo in exchange for two young scorers and future draft considerations.Pick swaps acquired by the Spurs from Sacramento in the DeMar DeRozan trade.While fans might expect a superstar return for LeBron James , this package offers a different kind of value.Key Benefits for the Los Angeles Lakers • Two reliable young scorers: Both Devin Vassell and Keldon Johnson have proven they can average close to 20 points per game.• Versatile skillsets: Neither is expected to become a franchise star, but both can contribute in multiple roles on a contending team.• Support for Luka Doncic: Role players who can defend and score efficiently are crucial in the Lakers’ new era.• Future flexibility: The draft pick swaps give the team additional assets without locking them into expensive veteran contracts.As Bailey notes, “This might not be the type of LeBron trade return that some Lakers are hoping for, [but] getting an aging superstar off the team for two solid players and draft capital might be the Los Angeles Lakers’ best option moving forward.”Also read: New York Knicks Reportedly Keeping a Close Watch on Giannis Antetokounmpo’s Situation in the Milwaukee Bucks For the Spurs, the move would bring in a global icon in LeBron James, boosting both on-court performance and marketability. Pairing him with Victor Wembanyama could accelerate their rebuild, while adding Bronny James could help foster a long-term connection to the franchise.
Article Summary: Lebron james and his son, bronny james, could be traded to a western conference rival. Bleacher report’s andy bailey has outlined a deal that would send the father-son duo to the san antonio spurs. The spurs would receive devin vassell and keldon johnson in exchange for lebron james and future draft considerations.

Article Title: “I considered retirement”: Smelling salts banned in NFL, and George Kittle isn’t taking it lightly
Article Text:
NFL’s smelling salt ban leaves George Kittle outraged (Imagn Images)

George Kittle ‘distraught’ over NFL’s new smelling salt ban



The science and safety behind the NFL’s sudden move



George Kittle has never been one to shy away from making a scene - especially when it’s both hilarious and heartfelt. During a light-hearted yet surprising interruption at 49ers training camp, the San Francisco 49ers tight end made headlines after jokingly announcing he was “distraught” and even “considered retirement. ” The reason? A brand-new NFL policy that has banned smelling salts and ammonia packets from all league play starting in 2025.The impromptu moment unfolded when Kittle stormed the NFL Network set mid-interview, grabbing the mic while teammate Fred Warner was speaking. “I honestly just came up here to air a grievance,” he said, prompting laughter from those around. “Our team got a memo today that smelling salts and ammonia packets were made illegal in the NFL, and I've been distraught all day.” He then tossed in a cheeky bombshell: “I considered retirement. ”While clearly joking, Kittle wasn’t exaggerating his personal attachment to the now-banned item. “I'm an every-drive guy,” he emphasized, explaining that he uses smelling salts as part of his regular pre-snap ritual. “I miss them already,” he confessed, before quickly drawing a line at overuse: “Every play is too much.”The ban, however, is anything but a joke to the league.According to NFL Network’s Mike Garafolo, the memo referenced a 2024 alert from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), which cited growing concerns over the unregulated use of ammonia inhalants (AIs) — the broader category including smelling salts. The NFL’s head, neck, and spine committee echoed these concerns, recommending a full ban due to the potential for AIs to “mask certain neurologic signs and symptoms,” particularly those associated with concussions.The league’s official stance is firm. Players, coaches, and staff are prohibited from using or providing smelling salts in any game context — pregame, during play, or even halftime. The FDA highlighted troubling side effects like shortness of breath, seizures, vomiting, and even fainting, especially from unapproved or cheaply sourced products bought online.Smelling salts, once intended to revive fainting victims, have become a go-to stimulant for athletes in high-impact sports like football and hockey. While Kittle’s playful protest might have earned chuckles, the ban is rooted in player safety — a direction the league clearly isn't planning to reverse.Still, fans shouldn’t worry. Kittle just signed a lucrative extension, and despite the melodrama, he isn’t actually walking away from football. But one thing’s for sure — he definitely wants a compromise.Also Read: How Erin Andrews and Charissa Thompson remain unbiased despite close ties with top NFL players
Article Summary: Nfl’s smelling salt ban leaves george kittle outraged. San francisco 49ers tight end made headlines after jokingly announcing he was ‘distraught’ and even “considered retirement. ” the reason? A brand-new nfl policy that has banned smelling salts and ammonia packets from all league play starting in 2025.

Article Title: Carter Hart’s NHL future in limbo as NHL insider blasts return rumors post-Hockey Canada verdict
Article Text:
Carter Hart (Credits: Getty Images)

Elliotte Friedman says it’s ‘irresponsible’ to speculate on Carter Hart’s NHL future post-acquittal

The Mid Summer Check-In Across The NHL | 32 Thoughts

Public relations risk keeps teams like Oilers away from Carter Hart amid unresolved eligibility

The NHL future of Carter Hart remains shrouded in uncertainty, even after his acquittal in the high-profile Hockey Canada sexual assault case. While fans continue to debate whether the former Philadelphia Flyers goalie deserves another shot on the ice, NHL insider Elliotte Friedman has strongly advised against making any assumptions.Five members of Canada’s 2018 world junior hockey team were found not guilty of sexual assault, ending months-long trial that has garnered national attention since it began in April. Michael McLeod, Carter Hart, Alex Formenton, Dillon Dubé and Cal Foote were acquitted of all charges by Ontario Superior Court Justice Maria Carroccia.Speaking on his 32 Thoughts podcast, Elliotte Friedman addressed the growing speculation around Hart’s potential return to the league. Despite being found not guilty along with four other players in the 2018 Hockey Canada case, Hart’s status remains unresolved in the eyes of the NHL.“I think it is really irresponsible to speculate until we have a legal ruling on this,” Friedman said. “I don’t think anything more needs to be said about that until we know if they're eligible to play. I just don't think it's smart to speculate on where they could play.”The NHL has made it clear that acquittal does not equate to reinstatement.The league released a statement acknowledging that the players’ behavior—though not criminally punishable—was still “very disturbing” and “unacceptable.” The league added that it would be “reviewing and considering the judge's findings” before making any decisions about eligibility.While Hart is technically an unrestricted free agent, teams are hesitant. Analyst Avry Lewis-McDougall shut down rumors linking Hart to the Edmonton Oilers during the Fanatics View Hockey Show, stating bluntly: “It’s a hard no.” He cited both the unresolved nature of Hart’s status and the inevitable media firestorm.“Teams don’t want the PR headache,” he said. “You should be looking at somebody you can bring in with less baggage.”With the Oilers needing a reliable goalie after two consecutive Stanley Cup Final losses, Lewis-McDougall emphasized that Hart’s off-ice issues make him an unsuitable option—even if he’s cleared to return.For now, Carter Hart’s road back to the NHL remains a legal, ethical, and reputational maze.Also Read: “Keep it real and sensible”: Carey Price’s wife Angela responds to Sydney Sweeney’s American Eagle ad backlash Since early 2024, Hart has been on an indefinite leave of absence from hockey due to his alleged involvement in the 2018 Hockey Canada sexual assault scandal; upon reaching restricted free agency that offseason, the Flyers did not match his minimum qualifying salary offer and thereby released him.
Article Summary: Elliotte friedman says it's 'irresponsible' to speculate on carter hart's nhl future. Hart was found not guilty along with four other players in the 2018 hockey canada case. The nhl has made it clear that acquittal does not equate to reinstatement.

Article Title: How to watch Hard Knocks: Date, time, where to watch and everything you need to know about the must-watch NFL series premiere
Article Text:
How to watch Hard Knocks 2025 featuring the Buffalo Bills (Image via Buffalo Bills)

Hard Knocks with the Buffalo Bills: Premiere time, live stream, and full viewing guide



Hard Knocks: Training Camp with the Buffalo Bills | Episode 1 Preview | HBO Max

Episode 1: August 5

Episode 2: August 12

Episode 3: August 19

Episode 4: August 26

Episode 5: September 2

How to watch: Your options for catching every moment of Hard Knocks



The return of the NFL season also marks the comeback of one of football’s most beloved docuseries—HBO’s Hard Knocks. For the first time in its 24-year history, the cameras are rolling with the Buffalo Bills as they open training camp for the 2025 season. With unprecedented access to key figures like head coach Sean McDermott, GM Brandon Beane, and 2024 NFL MVP Josh Allen, fans are in for an inside look at a franchise hungry to overcome past postseason heartbreaks.Premiering August 5 at 9 p.m. ET on HBO and streaming on HBO Max, Hard Knocks: Training Camp with the Buffalo Bills offers a rare glimpse into the lives and challenges of both veteran leaders and rising rookies. The Bills are heading into the 2025-26 season as five-time reigning AFC East champions. However, despite their dominance in the regular season, they’ve repeatedly fallen short in the playoffs—most recently losing to the Kansas City Chiefs in the AFC Championship Game for the fourth consecutive time.This year's Hard Knocks doesn't just chronicle a team preparing for another title run—it follows a roster fighting to rewrite its narrative.With Liev Schreiber returning as narrator, expect the same cinematic storytelling that has captivated football fans for over two decades.The five-episode season airs weekly on Tuesdays, culminating in a September 2 finale. Here's the full episode release guide:Watching Hard Knocks this year is easier than ever. If you don’t have HBO through cable, you can stream the series on HBO Max starting at $9.99/month with ads or opt for the ad-free experience at $16.99/month. You can also subscribe via Prime Video or through Sling TV with the Blue plan and an HBO Max add-on.Even better, Sling offers budget-friendly options—like 50% off your first month, plus $5 off each month after when adding HBO Max.Another convenient way? The Disney Bundle Trio, which includes HBO Max, Disney+, and Hulu for just $16.99/month—a perfect package for sports fans and binge-watchers alike.Also Read: “I considered retirement”: Smelling salts banned in NFL, and George Kittle isn’t taking it lightly
Article Summary: Hard knocks: training camp with the buffalo bills premieres august 5 at 9 p.m. Et on hbo and streaming on hbo max. The five-episode season airs weekly on tuesdays, culminating in a september 2 finale. With liev schreiber returning as narrator, expect the same cinematic storytelling.

Article Title: Daniel Cormier defends long haired Brock Lesnar as WWE faces heat for comeback after lawsuit scandal
Article Text:
Daniel Cormier defends long haired Brock Lesnar as WWE faces heat for comeback after lawsuit scandal (Image via Getty)

UFC legend Daniel Cormier and Chael Sonnen on Brock Lesnar’s return

“They pop for him … they tweaked him a little bit with the hair. I thought it worked.”

Brock Lesnar’s comeback context and legal background

Brock Lesnar made a shocking return to WWE on August 3, 2025, at SummerSlam Night Two in MetLife Stadium, New Jersey. After being away since SummerSlam 2023, he surprised everyone by attacking John Cena, just minutes after Cena lost the Undisputed WWE Title to Cody Rhodes. UFC legends Daniel Cormier and Chael Sonnen spoke about Lesnar’s comeback on Cormier’s Mightycast podcast, noting how Lesnar’s new long‑haired look and his sheer presence still make him a top star. They said it felt like Lesnar could still lead the WWE show.Daniel Cormier and Chael Sonnen began their discussion by recalling Lesnar’s entrance at SummerSlam Night Two. Cormier said the show “delivered” when Lesnar came back. Sonnen agreed and noted that WWE tweaked Lesnar’s appearance slightly adding long hair and the crowd loved it. He said:Daniel Cormier added that Lesnar “looked tremendous” and still seems like someone who “could run the WWE.” His tone made it clear: even after two years away, Lesnar’s presence feels dominant and very much in control.Brock Lesnar had not appeared on WWE since he lost to Cody Rhodes at SummerSlam 2023. WWE pulled him from shows, including Royal Rumble 2024, after Brock’s name surfaced in the Janel Grant lawsuit against Vince McMahon. Lesnar was mentioned in the amended complaint filed in February 2025. That legal issue had kept him off TV.Also Read: “Stop Practicing With Men”: Andre Agassi’s Father Once Blamed Male Practice Partners For Shocking Downfall Of Serena Williams And Venus Williams Daniel Cormier had even said Lesnar was on a “banned list,” though it wasn’t clear whether that was by UFC, WWE or TKO. Despite that, WWE legal cleared him for a return weeks before SummerSlam. His comeback was kept secret even WWE staff and media were told nothing.At the end of John Cena vs. CodyRhodes, as the crowd was still cheering, Brock Lesnar’s music hit. He stormed the ring and hit Cena with his signature F‑5 finisher. Then he left without speaking. The show closed on that shocking moment.
Article Summary: Brock lesnar made a shocking return to wwe on august 3, 2025, at summerslam night two in metlife stadium, new jersey. Ufc legends daniel cormier and chael sonnen spoke about lesnar’s comeback on cormier's mightycast podcast. They said it felt like lesnar could still lead the wwe show.

Article Title: Connor Bedard is carrying a franchise with no real plan — why are the Blackhawks wasting a generational talent?
Article Text:
Chicago Blackhawks' offseason strategy faces scrutiny as they haven't adequately supported Connor Bedard (Getty Images)

Chicago’s offseason moves lack the firepower Connor Bedard needs right now

Banking on prospects won’t cut it for a team in need of progress



As the 2025 NHL offseason nears its end, one glaring oversight from the Chicago Blackhawks continues to spark concern: the team has done little to meaningfully support Connor Bedard. Despite high hopes following his promising rookie campaign, Chicago’s reluctance to add top-tier talent raises questions about the front office’s long-term strategy—and whether it's setting up its young star to succeed or fail.After a disappointing 2024–25 season that saw the Blackhawks fire head coach Luke Richardson and stumble to another forgettable finish, fans expected the franchise to get aggressive in free agency. At one point, Chicago was even loosely linked to Mitch Marner before he landed in Vegas. But instead of landing a game-changer, the Blackhawks settled for smaller trade-market moves—sending Joe Veleno to Seattle for Andre Burakovsky and reacquiring Sam Lafferty from Buffalo.While Burakovsky has potential, his recent form leaves room for doubt. Lafferty, though valuable in a bottom-six role, won't share much ice time with Bedard.And that’s the problem—none of these moves bring the high-skill, top-line help the Blackhawks’ 19-year-old cornerstone desperately needs.Chicago's front office seems committed to giving their young players a shot at roster spots. That long-term vision is admirable, but it comes at the cost of short-term development. Bedard may be the future, but he needs support now to build confidence and elevate his play.Free agents like Jonathan Drouin, Andrew Mangiapane, or even a more ambitious play for Nikolaj Ehlers could’ve changed the dynamic completely. And there’s still a chance to correct course—names like Jack Roslovic remain available and could slot in as immediate help.Also Read: Connor McDavid Trade Bombshell to the Bruins: NHL insiders say it could guarantee a Stanley Cup win For now, though, the Blackhawks are skating on thin ice. “Bedard needs players he can count on right now,” and unless that changes soon, Chicago risks wasting another crucial year of their franchise savior’s development.
Article Summary: Chicago blackhawks' offseason strategy faces scrutiny as they haven't adequately supported connor bedard. Chicago's reluctance to add top-tier talent raises questions about the front office's long-term strategy. Bedard may be the future, but he needs support now to build confidence and elevate his play.

Article Title: Mitch Marner’s shocking trade shakes Leafs Nation as Nick Robertson trade buzz grows louder
Article Text:
Toronto Maple Leafs are facing turmoil after their playoff exit, highlighted by Mitch Marner's trade (Photo by Gerry Angus/Icon Sportswire)

Nick Robertson emerges as trade rumor target amid identity crisis

Can Robertson fill the Marner-sized hole — or is he being set up to fail?

The Toronto Maple Leafs’ offseason has taken a turbulent turn, with the franchise still reeling from another early playoff exit. But it’s not just the loss to the Florida Panthers that has fans restless — it’s the massive shake-up that followed. Mitch Marner, one of the team’s cornerstone stars, is no longer wearing blue and white. His sign-and-trade to the Vegas Golden Knights — where he inked an 8-year, $96 million deal — sent shockwaves through Leafs Nation.While the Leafs received Nicolas Roy in return, his bottom-six forward role is no match for the offensive engine that was Marner. With 102 points last season and 741 over his nine-year career in Toronto, replacing him isn't just hard — it’s nearly impossible.“Mitch Marner was far more than a point scorer… he carried the team’s offensive burden night after night,” the article states.As the team begins to recalibrate, another name is surfacing — Nick Robertson. A recent episode of the 32 Thoughts Podcast lit up speculation when insider Elliotte Friedman said: “I had a couple people ask me about the possibility of Nick Robertson and Pittsburgh; Kyle Dubas knows him…”Dubas, now at the helm in Pittsburgh, drafted Robertson in 2019 and may see untapped potential in the 24-year-old winger.Robertson has battled through injuries but showed glimpses of promise, posting 27 points in 56 games in 2023–24 and returning healthy last season.With his recent one-year, $1.2 million deal, the Leafs seem to be keeping doors open. But the bigger question is: are they investing in his growth, or simply boosting his trade value?While Robertson lacks Marner’s pedigree, his cost-effective contract and improving form make him an intriguing piece. Whether the Leafs see him as a long-term asset or a short-term solution remains unclear.Also Read: Carter Hart’s NHL future in limbo as Elliotte Friedman blasts return rumors post-Hockey Canada verdict In a cap-crunched, expectation-heavy city like Toronto, hope is never cheap — and patience, even less so.
Article Summary: Toronto maple leafs are facing turmoil after their playoff exit. Mitch marner, one of the team’s cornerstone stars, is no longer wearing blue and white. Nick robertson has battled through injuries but showed glimpses of promise, posting 27 points in 56 games in 2023–24.

Article Title: Kirby Dach’s recovery timeline raises doubts about return for Montreal Canadiens’ 2025–26 NHL season opener
Article Text:
Tony Gutierrez/AP

Kirby Dach recovery timeline casts doubt on Montreal Canadiens lineup for 2025–26 NHL opening night

Montreal Canadiens urged to prioritize Kirby Dach’s long-term health over early NHL return after knee injury

Montreal Canadiens forward Kirby Dach may not be ready for the start of the 2025–26 NHL season, as recovery from his knee surgery is reportedly still ongoing. According to a new report, the 24-year-old has yet to fully heal from the procedure he underwent after suffering an injury in late February. Concerns are now growing about his availability for opening night.The uncertainty around Kirby Dach's recovery gained traction after journalist Maxime Truman reported that the forward is still not fully recovered. That report was further supported by comments from an orthopedic surgeon, who spoke to HFTV, stating that the general recovery window for a professional athlete after such a procedure is between 6–9 months. However, the surgeon added that if it was a repeat surgery, the recovery timeline could be even longer.Considering Dach's injury occurred near the end of February, the standard timeline places his return somewhere between late August and November. While there remains a chance that Dach could return in time for the Montreal Canadiens' season opener, it is far from guaranteed. His actual availability will depend heavily on when he resumes skating and how his knee responds in the coming weeks.While Canadiens fans hope to see Dach in the lineup on opening night, many believe the organization should exercise caution. A rushed return could risk aggravating the injury or causing long-term setbacks. Several observers, including Truman, emphasized the importance of allowing Dach to recover fully before rejoining the team.Dach, originally drafted third overall by the Chicago Blackhawks in 2019, was traded to the Canadiens in 2022 and has since become a key piece in Montreal’s rebuilding efforts. Ensuring his long-term health is viewed as essential not just for the current season but for the franchise’s future success.Although having Kirby Dach ready for the 2025–26 NHL season opener would benefit the Montreal Canadiens, the focus remains on his complete recovery. With his long-term value to the team in mind, both the medical staff and front office are expected to proceed with caution, prioritizing health over haste.Also Read: Toronto Maple Leafs ink William Villeneuve to new contract for 2025–26 season after breakout AHL year
Article Summary: Montreal canadiens forward kirby dach may not be ready for the start of the 2025–26 nhl season, as recovery from his knee surgery is reportedly still ongoing. According to a new report, the 24-year-old has yet to fully heal from the procedure he underwent after suffering an injury in late february.

Article Title: Why 5x NBA All-Star Wants to Join the Los Angeles Lakers and How His Hollywood Hopes are Halted by Salary Cap Restrictions
Article Text:
Kevin Love of the Miami Heat (Image via USA TODAY Sports)

Kevin Love

The Salary Cap Barrier Blocking an LA Move

Los Angeles Lakers guard RJ Davis (26) dribbles against Dallas Mavericks guard Ryan Nembhard (9) in the first quarter of their game at Thomas & Mack Center (Image via Candice Ward-Imagn Images)

How Recent Moves Highlight the Problem

Why Los Angeles Holds Special Meaning for Kevin Love

What Could Happen Next

, a five-time NBA All-Star and one of the league’s most respected veterans, has entered trade season with a clear goal - landing with the Los Angeles Lakers or LA Clippers. After completing his 17th season with the Miami Heat, where he delivered steady production and veteran leadership, Love became part of a major three-team deal.The trade sent John Collins to the Clippers, Norman Powell to Miami, and Kevin Love - along with Kyle Anderson - to the Utah Jazz. At nearly 37, Love has little interest in joining a rebuilding effort in Utah, instead setting his sights on a buyout and a final playoff push in Los Angeles, where he could reunite with former teammates or coaches.While the Lakers and Clippers would both welcome a stretch big with Kevin Love’s pedigree, the hard cap presents a major roadblock. Due to recent high-profile acquisitions, both franchises are hard-capped at the first salary apron.• Lakers: Sitting just $1.1 million under the first apron, any move for Love would require clearing a roster spot and freeing enough space below the cap - likely through trading or waiving guaranteed contracts.• Clippers: Only $1.2 million below the apron after blockbuster moves for Bradley Beal and Chris Paul, the team would face a similar challenge, potentially having to give up a young player or key contract to fit Love under the cap.Recent roster decisions by both LA teams show just how tight the margins are:• The Lakers waived players like Jordan Goodwin and Shake Milton to fit in Deandre Ayton and Marcus Smart.• The Clippers had to waive Jordan Miller and Drew Eubanks to sign Chris Paul and Bradley Beal, later re-signing Miller on a two-way deal.For contenders already managing limited flexibility, taking on a veteran in the twilight of his career comes with risk.Kevin Love’s interest in Los Angeles isn’t solely about basketball:• California Connections: Raised in Oregon but a star at UCLA, Love has deep ties to LA’s basketball community.• Familiar Faces: Potential reunions with LeBron James on the Lakers or Tyronn Lue with the Clippers add a personal incentive.• Defined Playoff Role: Even in a limited capacity, his shooting, toughness, and leadership fit the mold for teams chasing a championship.The most likely path for Kevin Love involves a Jazz buyout followed by waiting for midseason when teams often have more roster flexibility. Alternatively, the Lakers or Clippers could free up space now, but that would require sacrificing depth or valuable contracts.Also read: De’Aaron Fox Signs $229 Million Extension, Shares Emotional Message with San Antonio Spurs Fans For now, the veteran forward’s desire to finish his career in LA remains stuck between ambition and financial reality - a reminder that even for proven champions, the NBA’s hard cap can be an immovable obstacle.
Article Summary: Kevin love is a five-time nba all-star and one of the league’s most respected veterans. The veteran forward has entered trade season with a clear goal - landing with the los angeles lakers or la clippers. The lakers and clippers would both welcome a stretch big with love's pedigree, but the hard cap presents a major roadblock.

Article Title: De’Aaron Fox Signs $229 Million Extension, Shares Emotional Message with San Antonio Spurs Fans
Article Text:
De'Aaron Fox extended his contract with the San Antonio Spurs (Image via Getty Images)

San Antonio Spurs

De’Aaron Fox

How De’Aaron Fox Went From Kings’ Cornerstone to San Antonio Spurs’ Backcourt Leader

De’Aaron Fox’s Heartfelt Message to San Antonio Spurs

Why the San Antonio Spurs Made Extended Fox's Contract

Mixed Reactions and What’s Next

Thehave made a franchise-defining move, securing point guardon a four-year, $229 million maximum contract extension. The deal, confirmed by Klutch Sports CEO Rich Paul and first reported by ESPN’s Shams Charania, runs through the 2029-30 NBA season with no player options or trade kickers - making it one of the largest contracts in league history. De’Aaron Fox , once the centerpiece of the Sacramento Kings, grew frustrated with the team’s trajectory last season. Reports indicated he had no interest in extending his contract in Sacramento, paving the way for a blockbuster trade before the deadline. The San Antonio Spurs, eager to fast-track their rebuild and pair a proven playmaker with emerging star Victor Wembanyama, capitalized.The trade, which also involved the Chicago Bulls , brought Fox to San Antonio. His debut run was shortened to 17 games due to a thumb injury, but his numbers - 19.7 points, 6.8 assists, 4.3 rebounds, and 1.5 steals per game - showed exactly why the Spurs view him as a foundational piece in their push toward playoff contention.Shortly after signing, De’Aaron Fox took to X to address the San Antonio Spurs community: “San Antonio! So thankful to be a part of an incredible organization, it’s an honor to put on black and silver. Can’t wait for us to make our future! Race for Seis! Go Spurs Go,”Accompanied by silver and black heart emojis, the post signaled Fox’s pride in joining the franchise and his commitment to chasing a sixth championship for San Antonio.At an average of $57.25 million per year, Fox now ranks among the NBA’s top earners. While some critics question paying that figure to a player with only one All-Star selection and limited playoff success, Spurs leadership sees the extension as a strategic investment.With rookies Dylan Harper (No. 2 overall pick) and Stephon Castle (reigning Rookie of the Year) joining Wembanyama, Fox’s leadership and playmaking are seen as critical to bridging youth with experience. The SSan Antonio purs’ favorable salary situation means they can absorb Fox’s contract without immediately hitting the luxury tax - giving them flexibility until their young core becomes eligible for extensions.The deal has sparked debate across the league. Supporters envision a dynamic San Antonio Spurs backcourt and a return to fast-paced, high-energy basketball. Skeptics, however, wonder if De’Aaron Fox’s production matches the price tag and whether he could eventually be moved if younger guards develop into primary ballhandlers.Also read: Boston Celtics Weigh Trade Options and Roster Adjustments Ahead of 2025-26 Season For now, the San Antonio Spurs’ commitment is clear: build around Wembanyama while giving the team a proven floor general to guide them into contention. And with Fox’s optimistic rallying cry - “Race for Seis!” - San Antonio’s next chapter begins with both ambition and belief.
Article Summary: The san antonio spurs have signed de'aaron fox to a four-year, $229 million contract extension. The deal runs through the 2029-30 nba season with no player options or trade kickers. At an average of $57.25 million per year, fox now ranks among the nba’s top earners.

Article Title: How Erin Andrews and Charissa Thompson remain unbiased despite close ties with top NFL players
Article Text:
How Erin Andrews and Charissa Thompson navigate NFL friendships without crossing journalistic lines (Instagram)

Erin Andrews and Charissa Thompson on covering NFL’s biggest names



What it was like meeting Taylor Swift | Calm Down Podcast

They have built some real relationship, real moments over the years



Some stories in sports broadcasting go beyond stats and sidelines — they’re about the people behind the mic and the bonds they form along the way. For Erin Andrews and Charissa Thompson, covering the NFL isn’t just a job. It’s a lifelong passion wrapped in genuine friendships, unforgettable moments, and the occasional fangirl reaction. In a candid chat on their Calm Down podcast, the Fox Sports veterans opened up about the delicate, often hilarious balance of staying professional while cheering on the very athletes they’ve grown close to over the years.It’s rare to hear seasoned broadcasters admit they still get starstruck, but Andrews and Thompson wear their enthusiasm proudly. “I don’t,” Andrews said when asked how she maintains composure around NFL icons. “I’m a huge fan of all the guys I cover and I get so excited to talk to them.” Her co-host, Thompson, echoed the sentiment, recalling a thrilling comeback by Baker Mayfield. “That was probably not professional, but I didn’t care, that was f—king awesome,” she laughed.Their excitement doesn’t come from a lack of experience. Andrews has been with Fox since 2012 and has covered multiple Super Bowls, including Super Bowl 2025.Thompson leads Fox NFL Kickoff and co-hosts Thursday Night Football on Prime Video. Yet, even with such credentials, the spark of fandom remains — not as a weakness, but as a reflection of their love for the sport and its athletes.The personal connections Andrews and Thompson have built over the years — with stars like Aaron Rodgers, Patrick Mahomes , and Travis Kelce — are not just professional relationships. They’ve been nurtured through mutual trust, time, and authenticity. “It’s taken us a minute to get where we are,” Andrews explained. “You have to build up credibility… with not only viewers at home, your bosses and also, the players and the coaches.”That credibility has extended beyond the sideline. This past offseason, Andrews and Thompson vacationed with Kelce and his girlfriend, Taylor Swift — a couple whose relationship they famously supported from the start. “They want to see you having a good time and smiling,” Andrews shared, reflecting on Fox’s culture that encourages authenticity. “There is nothing wrong with sitting on the [show] desk with Baker after an amazing game... and be like, 'Can we just talk about this last play?' It’s awesome.”Their unique blend of enthusiasm and professionalism has earned them trust in both locker rooms and living rooms. With reported contract extensions on the horizon, it’s clear their approach — candid, joyful, and human — is a winning formula in today’s sports media.Also Read: “I feel guilty”: Christian McCaffrey can’t stop admiring Olivia Culpo’s strength in emotional message after baby’s arrival
Article Summary: Erin andrews and charissa thompson have covered the nfl for more than a decade. The fox sports veterans opened up about the delicate balance of staying professional while cheering on the very athletes they've grown close to over the years. Their unique blend of enthusiasm and professionalism has earned them trust in both locker rooms and living rooms.

Article Title: The Buffalo Sabres shake the NHL trade with Devon Levi’s leap, Bowen Byram buzz and JJ Peterka’s surprising pivot
Article Text:
NHL- JJ Peterka (Credit: Getty Images)

Devon Levi Highlights All 7 NHL GAMES of Rookie Year with BUFFALO SABRES

Bowen Byram extension sparks trade whispers



JJ Peterka trade shakes the forward corps



JJ Peterka Discusses Being Traded to Utah Mammoth from Buffalo Sabres & Impressions of Utah Hockey

The Buffalo Sabres look set to flip the script

The Buffalo Sabres have doubled down on their belief in goaltender Devon Levi, signing the young netminder to a two-year deal that signals a serious opportunity. After flashing brilliance in the American Hockey League with a .919 save percentage and seven shutouts for the Rochester Americans, Levi now finds himself in the thick of the NHL goaltending race.Inking defenseman Bowen Byram to a two-year, $12.5 million extension should have settled the Sabres' blue line. Instead, it stirred rumors across the league. Though the front office isn’t actively shopping the former top pick, insiders suggest Buffalo is at least listening to offers, particularly for a potential upgrade up front or a right-shot defenseman.Byram logged big minutes last season, excelling in shot-blocking and defensive coverage. But with the Sabres still reshaping their identity, his high trade value could be the key to acquiring a top-six NHL forward.In a bold move that stunned fans. As the Sabres traded 25-goal scorer JJ Peterka to the Utah Hockey Club. In return, Buffalo landed right-shot defenseman Michael Kesselring and high-upside forward Josh Doan. While the departure of Peterka’s offensive production stings, this could be a long-term play with big potential.Kesselring’s size and raw ability could make him an ideal partner for Owen Power, while Doan brings grit and a two-way game that Buffalo has been missing in the middle six. If Doan breaks out and Kesselring develops quickly. This trade could be viewed as a win, especially with Peterka due for a big payday in the coming years.As the 2025–26 NHL season approaches, the Buffalo Sabres are clearly not settling. Even for another year on the playoff bubble. From bold signings to risk-filled trades, the front office is signaling that the rebuild is over. The NHL’s youngest roster is now aiming for relevance, and possibly redemption. For a team starving for postseason hockey, the time to strike might finally be here.Also Read: Acquitted but not cleared: NHL’s Michael McLeod now linked to second alleged sexual assault case
Article Summary: Buffalo sabres have signed goaltender devon levi to a two-year deal. The sabres traded 25-goal scorer jj peterka to the utah hockey club. In return, buffalo landed right-shot defenseman michael kesselring and high-upside forward josh doan.

Coach Aleksander Sekulic expressed excitement about Doncic's return, noting his positive impact on and off the court, as Slovenia gears up for friendly matches and the upcoming tournament.
